alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:06AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, Greensville, Southampton, southwestern Prince George, Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie, central Surry and southern Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 400 AM EDT... At 304 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking several clusters of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sedley to near Claresville to near Roanoke Rapids. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Emporia, Waverly, Lawrenceville, Courtland, Wakefield, Dahlia, Purdy, Brunswick, Sussex, Gaston, Jarratt, Ivor, Dendron, Stony Creek, Elberon, Green Plain, Carson, Homeville and Sedley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex
